title: 'July uprising, inspired by spirit of Victory day, opened path to rebuilding Bangladesh'
body: '“The spirit of this day brings a deep sense of gratitude, respect and love for the martyred and injured freedom fighters' Adviser to the Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs Dr Asif Nazrul on Tuesday said Victory Day on December 16 is the most significant day for the people of Bangladesh, as it recalls the glory of the Liberation War, the extraordinary contributions of the heroic freedom fighters, and the nation’s resolve to build the country. Dr Nazrul, who also serves as adviser to the ministries of Expatriates’ Welfare and Overseas Employment, and Youth and Sports, made the remarks while speaking to journalists after paying tribute at the National Martyrs’ Memorial in Savar at around 7:45 am on Tuesday (16 December). He said the spirit and determination embodied on December 16 enabled the historic July mass uprising, which in turn created an opportunity to rebuild Bangladesh. “The spirit of this day brings a deep sense of gratitude, respect and love for the martyred and injured freedom fighters who, through immense sacrifice, secured the country’s independence,” he said.
